intro: Pedicularis cephalantha var. cephalantha, commonly known as the helmeted lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking red or purple flowers that resemble lice, hence its common name. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Its botanical features include fleshy stems, opposite leaves, and a distinctive floral structure that attracts pollinators like bees and flies.
